sub_strands.name: Structure of the Atom
descriptions: Structure of the atom (protons, electrons, neutrons)
learning_outcomes: Describe the structure of the atom
Classify elements into metals and non-metals
learning_experiences: Use atomic models or simulations to represent atoms and their subatomic particles
Group discussions and drawing electron arrangements using dot and cross diagrams
Classification activities of elements into metals and non-metals using a periodic table
Research and present characteristics of subatomic particles
key_inquiries: What is the structure of an atom?
How are electrons arranged in an atom?
Why is classification into metals and non-metals important?
pertinent_issues: Health and safety â€“ handling of radioactive elements
other_learning_areas: Linked to Mathematics and Agriculture & Nutrition
non_formal_activities: Science club presentations on atoms and elements

skills.skill: Ability to describe the structure of the atom

rubrics.Exceeds: Describes the structure of the atom comprehensively
rubrics.Meets: Describes the structure of the atom sufficiently
rubrics.Approaches: Describes the structure of the atom partially
rubrics.Below: Describes the structure of the atom superficially

skills.skill: Ability to classify elements into metals and non-metals

rubrics.Exceeds: Classifies all elements into metals and nonmetals
rubrics.Meets: Classifies most elements into metals and nonmetals
rubrics.Approaches: Classifies some elements into metals and nonmetals
rubrics.Below: Classifies a few elements into metals and nonmetals with prompts

sub_strands.name: Metals and Alloys
descriptions: Composition of alloys (steel, brass, bronze, etc.)
learning_outcomes: Identify uses of metals and alloys
learning_experiences: Observe samples of metals and alloys to compare their physical properties
Investigate rusting and its effects on metals through experiments
Explore prevention methods for rusting (painting, oiling, galvanizing)
Discuss real-life uses of common alloys (steel, brass, bronze)
key_inquiries: What are the properties of metals and alloys?
How can rusting be prevented?
What are the uses of common alloys?
pertinent_issues: Sustainable use of metals and recycling
other_learning_areas: Linked to Pre-technical and Business Studies
non_formal_activities: Prepare a campaign on rust prevention methods

skills.skill: Ability to outline uses of metals and alloys

rubrics.Exceeds: Outlines uses of all metals and alloys correctly
rubrics.Meets: Outlines uses of most metals and alloys correctly
rubrics.Approaches: Outlines uses of some metals and alloys correctly
rubrics.Below: Outlines uses of a few metals and alloys correctly with prompts

skills.skill: Ability to explain the effect of rusting on metals

rubrics.Exceeds: Explains the effect of rusting on metals in detail comprehensively
rubrics.Meets: Explains the effect of rusting on metals sufficiently
rubrics.Approaches: Explains the effect of rusting on metals partially
rubrics.Below: Explains the effect of rusting on metals superficially

sub_strands.name: Water Hardness
descriptions: Advantages and disadvantages of both types
learning_experiences: Compare hard and soft water using soap lathering test
Investigate temporary hardness removal by boiling
Practice softening methods using chemicals (e.g., washing soda)
Group presentations on advantages/disadvantages of hard and soft water
key_inquiries: What causes water hardness?
How can it be softened?
What are the uses and drawbacks of hard vs soft water?
other_learning_areas: Linked to Home Science and Life Skills
non_formal_activities: Organize a demonstration on water softening methods

skills.skill: Ability to apply different methods to soften temporary hard water

rubrics.Exceeds: Applies all appropriate methods to soften temporary hard water
rubrics.Meets: Applies appropriate methods to soften temporary hard water

skills.skill: Ability to outline advantages and disadvantages of hard and soft water

rubrics.Exceeds: Outlines advantages and disadvantages in detail

sub_strands.name: Pollution
descriptions: Types of pollution: air, water, soil, noise, radioactive
learning_outcomes: Describe types and causes of pollution
Outline effects of pollution on environment and health
Show concern for pollution in the environment
learning_experiences: Carry out a field survey to identify types and sources of pollution in the community
Create posters or presentations on pollution control measures
Debate on individual vs collective responsibility in pollution prevention
Research and share impacts of pollution on ecosystems and health
key_inquiries: What are the types and causes of pollution?
What are the effects of pollution on health and the environment?
How can pollution be prevented or controlled?
other_learning_areas: Linked to Social Studies and Agriculture & Nutrition
non_formal_activities: Participate in a local clean-up or awareness campaign

skills.skill: Ability to describe different types of pollution and their causes

rubrics.Exceeds: Describes types and causes of pollution accurately and comprehensively
rubrics.Meets: Describes most types and causes of pollution correctly
rubrics.Approaches: Describes some types and causes of pollution
rubrics.Below: Describes a few types and causes of pollution with prompts

skills.skill: Ability to explain the effects of pollution on human health and the environment

rubrics.Exceeds: Explains the effects of pollution on human health and the environment in detail

sub_strands.name: Conservation of the Environment
descriptions: Roles of individuals and communities in conservation
learning_outcomes: Explain the importance of environmental conservation
Describe methods of conserving the environment
learning_experiences: Engage in a school-based tree planting or recycling project
Role-play environmental awareness campaigns
Design eco-friendly practices for home or school use
Research conservation organizations and their impact
key_inquiries: Why is environmental conservation important?
What are the methods of conserving natural resources?
How can individuals and communities take part in conservation?
other_learning_areas: Linked to Life Skills and Social Studies
non_formal_activities: Organize a conservation-themed exhibition or school-wide challenge

skills.skill: Ability to describe the importance of conserving the environment

rubrics.Exceeds: Describes importance of conserving the environment with multiple examples and clarity
rubrics.Meets: Describes importance of conserving the environment
rubrics.Below: Describes the importance superficially with prompts

skills.skill: Ability to apply environmental conservation practices

rubrics.Exceeds: Applies multiple conservation practices independently and consistently
rubrics.Meets: Applies appropriate practices with some supervision
rubrics.Approaches: Applies one or two practices with help
rubrics.Below: Applies practices with guidance and prompting

sub_strands.name: Friction
descriptions: Ways to reduce or increase friction
learning_outcomes: Explain the concept and causes of friction
Identify the advantages and disadvantages of friction
Appreciate the role of friction in everyday life
learning_experiences: Experiment with surfaces to observe effects of friction
Demonstrate how friction can be reduced or increased
Use real-life tools (sandpaper, oil, etc.) to simulate friction control
Discuss pros and cons of friction in daily situations
key_inquiries: What causes friction?
How is friction useful and how can it be a disadvantage?
How can friction be increased or reduced?
pertinent_issues: Health and safety in daily operations (machinery, tools, etc.)
other_learning_areas: Linked to Pre-technical and Business Studies
non_formal_activities: Investigate and document friction-reducing practices at home or in the community

skills.skill: Ability to describe the concept of friction and its effects

rubrics.Exceeds: Clearly describes the concept and gives real-life applications with accuracy
rubrics.Meets: Describes the concept of friction and gives examples
rubrics.Below: Describes friction with prompts or unclear examples

skills.skill: Ability to identify ways of reducing or increasing friction

rubrics.Exceeds: Identifies and justifies multiple ways to increase or reduce friction
rubrics.Meets: Identifies correct methods to increase or reduce friction
rubrics.Approaches: Identifies some ways with limited accuracy
rubrics.Below: Identifies few or incorrect ways with prompting

sub_strands.name: Machines
descriptions: Simple machines: levers, pulleys, inclined planes, gears, etc.
Functions of machines in work and daily life
Mechanical advantage, load, effort, and efficiency
learning_outcomes: Explain their working principles and uses
Appreciate the role of machines in improving life
learning_experiences: Use models to demonstrate types of simple machines
Experiment with pulleys and levers to calculate force
Explore tools and equipment in home/work settings
Work in groups to design a simple machine for a given task
key_inquiries: What are simple machines and how do they work?
How do machines make work easier?
What is mechanical advantage and efficiency?
other_learning_areas: Linked to Mathematics and Pre-technical Studies
non_formal_activities: Participate in a simple machine design contest or demonstration day

skills.skill: Ability to identify and explain functions of simple machines

rubrics.Exceeds: Identifies all simple machines and explains their functions clearly with real-life examples
rubrics.Meets: Identifies most machines and explains functions accurately
rubrics.Approaches: Identifies some machines and gives limited function explanation
rubrics.Below: Identifies few machines and gives unclear or prompted explanation

skills.skill: Ability to calculate mechanical advantage and efficiency

rubrics.Exceeds: Accurately calculates mechanical advantage and efficiency with correct units and formulas
rubrics.Meets: Calculates mechanical advantage and efficiency correctly
